name: Cerdos en una Manta (Pigs in a Blanket)
author: andrewgrant9
summary: A Mexican twist on 'pigs in a blanket,' this is not your ordinary hot dog wrapped in a crescent roll.
ingredients: ¼ cup chopped red bell pepper
⅓ cup shredded Mexican cheese blend
1 (16 ounce) can refrigerated buttermilk biscuit roll dough
¼ teaspoon hot sauce, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir chorizo in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes
Remove chorizo with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towel to drain, retaining drippings in the skillet
Saute red bell pepper, red onion, and jalapeno pepper in reserved chorizo drippings until tender, 5 to 7 minutes
Remove with a slotted spoon to a plate lined with paper towel to drain
Flatten biscuit roll dough into 4 4x6-inch rectangles, pressing seams together where needed
Mix chorizo and vegetable mixture in a bowl; spoon into the center of each rectangle and top with cheese
Roll dough, taking care to seal contents inside the dough
Arrange 'blankets' on a baking sheet so the seams are down
Check for holes and seal as found
Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes; transfer to a serving platter and season with hot sauce
